results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2024;Polls and Public Opinion;United States Economy;Voting and Voters;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party
results.title: Most Democrats Don’t Want Biden in 2024, New Poll Shows
results.abstract: With the country gripped by a pervasive sense of pessimism, the president is hemorrhaging support.

media.caption: President Biden in Cleveland last week. Only 26 percent of Democratic voters said the party should renominate him in 2024.

results.adx_keywords: Space and Astronomy;James Webb Space Telescope
results.byline: By Dennis Overbye, Kenneth Chang and Jim Tankersley
results.title: Biden and NASA Share First Webb Space Telescope Image
results.abstract: From the White House on Monday, humanity got its first glimpse of what the observatory in space has been seeing: a cluster of early galaxies.

media.caption: The Webb telescope’s image of the galaxy cluster SMACS 0723 includes thousands of galaxies, including the faintest objects ever observed in infrared. The light from SMACS 0723 in this image is 4.6 billion years old.

results.title: He Fixed NASA’s Giant Space Telescope, Reluctantly
results.abstract: Gregory Robinson was enjoying another job when NASA persuaded him to take on an enormous astronomy project that was billions of dollars over budget and years behind schedule.

media.caption: Gregory L. Robinson, director for the James Webb Space Telescope Program. “Things happen in there that you don’t see,” he said. “The ghosts always catch you, right?”

results.title: At 79, Biden Is Testing the Boundaries of Age and the Presidency
results.abstract: President Biden has said he plans to run for a second term, but his age has become an uncomfortable issue for him and his party.
